Owlhawk:  Talk to a technician.  If we did notice it I was 
clueless.....well we should get in the base.  Even for a transmetal 
it's a bad idea to spend to much time outside on this rock in robot 
mode.  The energon can fry you.  Follow me.  BEAST MODE!

He transformed.

Owlhawk:  By the way it's 'til' all are one'.

He took off and headed back to base, but opened a comlink.

Owlhawk:  Owlhawk to base.  I think these may be a newly discovered 
type of Transformers we have no knowledge of.  They claim not to even 
know what Maximals and Predicons are, but get ready to blast them if 
they turn out to be hostile.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Katya looks confusely at him.
> 
> Katya: I know of "Thus shall it stand until we all shall fall". It 
is 
> a ceremonial sentence. But I do not know about yours.
> 
> Ragnar: And we are no more familiar with predacon than we are with 
> Maximals. We are on this stravag world since the wave hit our ship 
> above Strana Mechty. If you did not notice the destroyed warship 
> falling down, then maybe you should check your sensors better.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > OOC: I know but Owlhawk doesn't.
> > 
> > BIC:  Owlhawk looked confused.
> > 
> > Owlhawk:  Look I don't know what the Pit you are, but I have no 
> > reason to think you're not Predicon spies.  When did your ship 
land? 
>  
> > It seems we would have noticed it?  Or did you come out of stasis 
> > pods?
> > 
> > Then it occurs to Owlhawk these strange creatures don't seem to 
be 
> > Cybertronian, or even have any communication with them.  He may 
have 
> > found a new race of transformers.  He decides to test them.
> > 
> > Owlhawk:  FINISH THIS SENTENCE!  "TIL' ALL ARE...."
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > OOC: there are only Ghost Bear and Wolf Clans insignia visible. 
> > They 
> > > are in mech mode so he probably won't see them as human.
> > > 
> > > Ragnar: What is that thing? It spoke! Is he hostile you think?
> > > 
> > > Katya: Best to use words for now. It seems to be armed with 
alien 
> > > technologies... Even an Elemental warrior would not completely 
> fill 
> > > such a huge battle armor... (She raised her voice) Who or 
whatever 
> > you 
> > > are, we are not hostile to you. We demand safcon, the safe 
passage 
> > > through this area. I am Galaxy commander Katya Kerensky, 
> Loremaster 
> > of 
> > > the Wolf Clan, and I travel with Star Colonel Ragnar of the 
Ghost 
> > Bear 
> > > Clan.
> > > 
> > > Ragnar: There is more. We do not know what a Maximal is. We may 
> not 
> > be 
> > > hostile, but in the event of your attack, we will make sure you 
> > regret 
> > > ever pointing a weapon at us. So, shall this be a friendly chat 
or 
> > a 
> > > trial of grievance?
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > > > OOC: These are the ones approaching the Maxi base
> > > > right?
> > > > 
> > > > Owlhawk landed, and went to robot mode and pointed
> > > > both his automatic guns, and mini plasma canons at
> > > > them.  He eyed them suspiciously before speaching.
> > > > 
> > > > Owlhawk:  I want to see Maximal ensignias ASAP.
> > > > 
> > > > OOC:  I don't know much about Battletech but I doubt
> > > > from the pictures I've seen he could see the humans.
> > > > 
> > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > In the grassy plain, the two mech-humans slowly
> > > > > advance, Katya 
> > > > > deliberately slowing down so the heavier Ragnar
> > > > > could catch up with 
> > > > > her. She was willing to know more of him, after he
> > > > > had left the true 
> > > > > Wolves.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Katya: Tell me, Ragnar, how was it with Phelan? And
> > > > > what happened in 
> > > > > the Arc-Royal Defense Cordon?
> > > > > 
> > > > > Ragnar smiled: Well, it has been a job to keep the
> > > > > Jade Falcons back 
> > > > > as we could from the cordon. The Kell Hounds did
> > > > > help a lot, and their 
> > > > > mech facilities helped us to rebuild a rather strong
> > > > > touman. Then, I 
> > > > > was captured by the Bears...
> > > > > 
> > > > > Katya: Ah yes! I remember Bjorn Jorgensson saying
> > > > > once you were a key 
> > > > > element for the Ghost Bears. What then?
> > > > > 
> > > > > Ragnar thought for a moment.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Ragnar: Bjorn is a man I can call my friend, a
> > > > > soldier I can call a 
> > > > > true warrior, and a politician of the kind of the
> > > > > Kerenskys! He 
> > > > > trusted me, pushed me back to the warrior's way and
> > > > > eventually gave me 
> > > > > command of the Rasalhague Bears. I never actually
> > > > > dreamt of commanding 
> > > > > warriors of my former nation among the Clans...
> > > > > 
> > > > > Katya remembered the time he was a wolf. A young and
> > > > > bright freeborn 
> > > > > warrior of kind of Phelan Kell. He would have been
> > > > > bloodnamed too if 
> > > > > he had proved to have common genetic material with
> > > > > clan bloodlines.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Her mind drifted and she looked at the sky. Her
> > > > > warden tendencies 
> > > > > never prevented her to rise in a crusader clan, but
> > > > > she did not like 
> > > > > the idea that she would not be totally able to
> > > > > prevent Vlad Ward to 
> > > > > conquer the Inner Sphere.
> > > > > 
> > > > > She saw something in the sky and magnified to see
> > > > > enough of it. 
> > > > > Unfortunately, she still could not make out what it
> > > > > was.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Katya: There is something coming. It seems metallic
> > > > > and it is coming 
> > > > > fast.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Ragnar: Then we prepare...
> > > > > 
> > > > > Both transformed, once more becoming the war
> > > > > machines they guised as, 
> > > > > ready to fight if need be.
> > > > > 
> > > > >
